author: brycem
body: This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/powershell/powershell/883)

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Since `Rename-Computer` are the tests that are [failing](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/PowerShell/powershell-linux/build/0.2.0.1357#L1225), I think you ran into #670. If that's the case, we just need to mark the tests as `-Pending` until @vors has that resolved.

comments.author: brycem
comments.body: Looks like rename-computer DRT is failing (NYI) - will remove and resubmit PR

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
Unfortunately, for the Linux failure, it's due to the PR coming from a repository that is not PowerShell/PowerShell. The secure [environment variable](https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/environment-variables/#Defining-Variables-in-Repository-Settings) we use to authenticate with GitHub (because the repo is still private) is only available to PRs made inside this repo.

Simplest solution is to push directly to PowerShell/PowerShell and open a new PR.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @brycem Just added you to the team with write-permissions so you don't have to use a fork any more :smile:

comments.author: brycem
comments.body: Ah - that'd explain the access error I was getting that drove the forking approach :-)  Thanks!

title: Porting Management DRT TTests from psl-monad to Pester.
